individual_metadata.synopsis: He is smarter than your average goblin, and is reading a manuscript - loose papers, freshly written by Volo. It's a study of goblin behaviour that would give anyone who reads it an advantage in combat against goblins.

20.speaker: Booyahg Piddle
20.text: You should go get a drink before the party dies down.
20.context: InternalNodeContext: Player met the sage, goblin doesn't have the book (the book could have been taken by either this player or another).

22.speaker: Booyahg Piddle
22.text: Someone's got it out for us. Find the bastard!

67.speaker: Booyahg Piddle
67.text: Huh? What do you want? I'm tryin' to concentrate on readin'!

106.speaker: Booyahg Piddle
106.text: Here - help us out. Sez here that 'goblinoids are obstreperous and malodorous'. What's that mean?
106.context: NodeContext: asking for help while struggling to read a manuscript - stumbling over the complicated quoted words

28.speaker: Booyahg Piddle
28.text: Smelliest thing around here is you, mate. That dung on yer mug's makin' my eyes water.

95.speaker: Booyahg Piddle
95.text: Hard enough readin' this without you stinkin' up the place.

87.speaker: Booyahg Piddle
87.text: Ain't that the truth! Proper stink around here now we've settled in.

100.speaker: Booyahg Piddle
100.text: An' all that ruckus makes it hard to concentrate on reading.
100.context: CinematicNodeContext: holding up the papers he's readingNodeContext: mildly irritated, waving papers in our face

16.speaker: Player
16.text: That's quite the compliment. It means you're extremely intelligent.

109.speaker: Booyahg Piddle
109.text: Bit confusin', cuz it sez we're 'feeble-minded weaklings' right before that.

57.speaker: Booyahg Piddle
57.text: Oh... Of course. Yeah, I'd have 'ad said that. Bit wordy though, innit?

54.speaker: Booyahg Piddle
54.text: Still - only other stuff to read around 'ere is the filth Klagga scrawls in the latrines.
54.context: NodeContext: cheering himself up - 'klagga' is another goblin, rhymes with 'dagger'

101.speaker: Booyahg Piddle
101.text: Belonged to some bloke that showed up here askin' questions. Bold as a bugbear, he woz!
101.context: NodeContext: explaining where he found a manuscript

19.speaker: Player
19.text: Most goblins I've met aren't terribly interested in reading.

11.speaker: Booyahg Piddle
11.text: That's wot the bloke who wrote this said! Proper impressed by my brain-smarts, he woz.

39.speaker: Booyahg Piddle
39.text: Said he's writin' a book about the Absolute. Lads didn't like that - said he was a spy or some such...

37.speaker: Booyahg Piddle
37.text: ... think they've locked 'im in the cells already.

4.speaker: Booyahg Piddle
4.text: ... that's 'im, at the party, warblin' away.
4.context: NodeContext: pointing over the player's shoulder at a captive bard

115.speaker: Booyahg Piddle
115.text: I had a good chinwag with him though. Interestin' bloke.

23.speaker: Player
23.text: That 'bloke' was Volothamp Geddarm, famed chronicler of the Realms.

102.speaker: Booyahg Piddle
102.text: Yeah, he mentioned that. About a thousand times.
102.context: NodeContext: Second sentence with an eye-roll - describing an arrogant man

111.speaker: Booyahg Piddle
111.text: Don't matter how famed he is; he's gonna end up as supper.

104.speaker: Player
104.text: What was so interesting about him?

2.speaker: Booyahg Piddle
2.text: He wanted to know if we felt any extra booyahg in the air since convertin'.
2.context: NodeContext: Booyahg is a word in the goblin language - 'Boo-yarg' (hard G). Explaining patiently

116.speaker: Booyahg Piddle
116.text: Magic. Them wot the Absolute chooses are brimmin' with it.

112.speaker: Booyahg Piddle
112.text: Priestess Gut and our boss Ragzlin, are fearsome powerful now. Same as that drow.
112.context: NodeContext: describing his superiors; in awe of them. Dror Ragzlin is pronounced 'Drawer RAGS-lin'

108.speaker: Wyll
108.text: Seems we've pegged all three marks. Let the boss hunt begin.

73.speaker: Booyahg Piddle
73.text: Priestess Gut and our boss Ragzlin, are fearsome powerful now. Same as that drow.
73.context: NodeContext: describing his superiors; in awe of them. Dror Ragzlin is pronounced 'Drawer RAGS-lin'

85.speaker: Player
85.text: And? Has your tribe's power increased?

30.speaker: Booyahg Piddle
30.text: Yeah - priestess Gut is fearsome powerful now. So's Ragzlin, our boss. Them's True Souls now. Just like that drow.
30.context: NodeContext: describing his bosses - in awe of them. Dror Ragzlin pronounced 'drawer RAGS-lin'

69.speaker: Booyahg Piddle
69.text: They have the kinda booyahg that comes from bein' chosen by a god.
69.context: NodeContext: booyahg is the goblin word for magic - 'boo'yarg' hard G. He's in awe of this power

92.speaker: Booyahg Piddle
92.text: They have the kinda booyahg that comes from bein' chosen by a god.
92.context: NodeContext: booyahg is the goblin word for magic - 'boo'yarg' hard G. He's in awe of this power

79.speaker: Player
79.text: Have you met any other interesting people? A druid, perhaps?

68.speaker: Booyahg Piddle
68.text: There were some troublemakers, but they're either dead or wishing they were. Don't know if there was a druid though.

50.speaker: Booyahg Piddle
50.text: He's probably down in the pens, fattenin' up the worgs like all the rest.

58.speaker: Player
58.text: This writer - will he be fed to the worgs too?

15.speaker: Booyahg Piddle
15.text: Nah. We're keepin' him as our own little plaything, so long as he don't ask any more awkward questions.

110.speaker: Booyahg Piddle
110.text: I ain't finished with it! There's enough readin' here to last me a lifetime.

38.speaker: Narrator
38.text: *The mark glows, but you feel nothing in response. Your illithid power is beyond reach until you rest.*

25.speaker: Narrator
25.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

99.speaker: Player
99.text: You're an authority on the Absolute - you should be the one writing about it.

96.speaker: Booyahg Piddle
96.text: You're right! What does some bleedin' outsider know that I don't? I'll be famous!

98.speaker: Booyahg Piddle
98.text: And nobody will remember this pack of lies.
98.context: CinematicNodeContext: throwing the manuscript on the floorNodeContext: sneering as he throws the manuscript he's carrying on the floor

17.speaker: Player
17.text: You will give me the book.

21.speaker: Booyahg Piddle
21.context: NodeContext: strained - we're dominating his mind telepathically

5.speaker: Narrator
5.text: *A shiver runs across your mind... You feel sated.*

18.speaker: Narrator
18.text: *Something stirs deep within you, hungry and alert... it's taking something you'll never get back.*

84.speaker: Narrator
84.text: *Your mind lurches, reeling suddenly as if... bitten.*

1.speaker: Narrator
1.text: *A shadow swims across your vision, and a familiar voice tells you to be calm. You are loved.*

14.speaker: Booyahg Piddle
14.text: You made me do that... didn't have no choice, did I?
14.context: NodeContext: confused...his head hurts. We just dominated his mind telepathically

70.speaker: Booyahg Piddle
70.text: That's some impressive booyahg. Absolute must like ya.
70.context: NodeContext: booyahg is the goblin word for magic - boo-yarg (hard G). he's in awe of us

89.speaker: Narrator
89.text: *Your blood runs quicker, feeding the gnawing absence at the centre of your mind.*

60.speaker: Narrator
60.text: *The presence deep in your mind is awake, unblinking. This is it. A single word pervades your consciousness: 'Soon'.*

48.speaker: Narrator
48.text: *Your mind is full, bursting with ecstasy and terror. Finally, it is coming. You are becoming.*

103.speaker: Player
103.text: You will give me the book.

34.speaker: Booyahg Piddle
34.text: Are you trying to scare me? Cuz it ain't working. Clear off.
34.context: NodeContext: mocking the player's attempt to threaten him

9.speaker: Player
9.text: Your lifetime gets shorter every second you keep that book.

61.speaker: Booyahg Piddle
61.text: Bloody hell - an' people say goblins are savage.
61.context: NodeContext: upset, afraid - we're bullying him

80.speaker: Booyahg Piddle
80.text: It ain't worth fightin' over. Take it!
80.context: NodeContext: upset afraid, we're bullying him

93.speaker: Booyahg Piddle
93.text: Wanna fight? Take your best shot.

107.speaker: Booyahg Piddle
107.text: Half the camp'll tear into ya before you have a chance to regret it.
107.context: NodeContext: mocking the player's attempt to threaten him

10.speaker: Player
10.text: A lifetime can be very short. Hand over the manuscript.

12.speaker: Player
12.text: It'll be a very short lifetime if you don't hand me the manuscript.

72.speaker: Player
72.text: You should spend your time in prayer - not reading this nonsense.

53.speaker: Booyahg Piddle
53.text: S'pose you're right. Absolute rewards faith, not book-learnin'.
53.context: NodeContext: after being persuaded to give something away - pleased to have learned something

45.speaker: Booyahg Piddle
45.text: Take it. Maybe if I pray hard enough I can get some of that booyahg for myself.

114.speaker: Booyahg Piddle
114.text: I pray plenty. Day and night. Don't mean I can't educate myself as well.

86.speaker: Booyahg Piddle
86.text: And that's what I'm gonna do. So buzz off.

78.speaker: Player
78.text: You should spend your time in prayer - not reading this nonsense.

49.speaker: Player
49.text: We both know this book's rubbish, Piddle. Write your own, and I'll edit it for you.

35.speaker: Booyahg Piddle
35.text: Hang about, you're jest trying to get my book, aintcha? Cheeky bastard. Get your own.

52.speaker: Booyahg Piddle
52.text: This stuff ain't bad... but somebody who really knows the Absolute should be writin' Her story.
52.context: NodeContext: internal monologue as we read his mind - heavy exaggeration on 'really'. He's thinking of himself as that 'somebody'.

88.speaker: Narrator
88.text: *As the symbol glows, power courses through you. Authority.*

66.speaker: Player
66.text: And Volo - will he be fed to the worgs too?

113.speaker: Booyahg Piddle
113.text: Wish I had my book back - think it was one of your mates who took it.
113.context: InternalNodeContext: Someone else has got the book from sage.
